review: Came for a Sneak Peak lunch before the official opening this coming Monday. Great looking facility, comfortable seating and atmosphere plus terrific service and food.  The battered broccoli is my new favorite appetizer for sure. Everything was delicious and I look forward to my next visit!

Went to soft opening today.  Was seated at bar.  The bar here is completely separated by partition to main restaurant. Would t have even noticed all the kiddies in the main dining area if I didn't have to walk thru it to get to restroom.  Good job tho on keeping the kids separate.  Standard issue RR menu. Today i tried the prime rib dip.   .  One of pricier items on menu, but quality is there.  Included Coke slaw and bottomless fries. As usual, I load up on ranch and buzz sauce.  Totally a fatty cheat meal, and great to was down with a Stella.  Only gripe.... The bar seating is awkward with the small aisle behind the seats. Apparently, the design is flawed where all servers coming from kitchen must pass through that aisle. This means if you sit at bar, expect to get your seat bumped at least every few minutes.  Only mention to see if management makes the needed adjustment. I'm guessing they will.  Food 5/5 Service: on par, or better than expected for soft opening. Many trainees.  Will update on future visits.

Came for the sneak peak lunch.  Server Joseph was excellent and very attentive. He recommended the Zombie for a mixed drink and it was awesome . Food was perfect and drinks were wonderfully cold and carbonated. The atmosphere was welcoming and fun.  Was exceptionally happy to find chalk board games available to play.  In addition to the wonderful meal my husband left his phone behind and the staff made a wonderful effort to find it and get it returned. Great team.  Great food. Great environment. Five stars all the way.

OMG! Went to the soft opening on Thursday & waited maybe 15 min. (Not bad) we sat at the bar which was ok. I kept getting bumped, it was tight & crowded but it was fine. Our waitress was Natalie & she was great & also Katrina helped us out after signing up "rewards" & we all received a free gift (red robin seasoning) it was pretty cool. I had the whiskey BBQ burger with garlic fries.....it was delicious!  My friends also enjoyed their food. We were very satisfied with the trainees.  Service was great & friendly!  Can't wait to go on Monday for their grand opening!!!

Came in for the soft opening today. Looks nice inside. My gripe was the seating. Got stuck at the corner spot of the bar. Employees kept bumping my chair. I wanted to sit next to my husband not elbow to elbow with random people. First off they ran out of onion rings. Second, we never got refills on drinks. My family went the day before and got a free milkshake sent to their table, plus they got their drinks to go.... I got neither of those. My salad was blah, i could have made the same thing at home. After we left a tip i bolted for the door. Ill stick to the red robin in ventura. Also, they gave us a card for a free dessert,milkshake or appetizer. Little did i know it expires the next day! Come on

Went to the soft opening, greeted by friendly people and who gave a little talk about what was included. Went to check in, the greeter was very upbeat. Told us it would be about a 15 minute wait then asked if that would be ok. Don't think it should be put that way, what if I said no, it's not ok. Would I have been seated right away? Think she should have said your table will be ready in a few minutes and offer a menu to look at until then. Very busy for the soft opening. Some items on the menu weren't available.  Our server, Nicole was very nice and attentive. Answered any questions we had. Food was very fresh and delicious. A lot of staff around, for opening and training but got congested in the aisle at times. Counted 10 staff standing in the walk way until another employee came along and told them to keep it moving. All in all a good experience. Will be back to this location again.

Had the opportunity to attend the soft opening (complementary beverages and entrees) twice, once on Wednesday and again on Saturday.  Wednesday was perfect.  Service was excellent.  Great job Bryan and Bobby.  You both made sure our every need was met.  Our meals were great.  They were just as I would have expected from other Red Robin locations.  Saturday was a little off, but keeping in mind this was a soft opening, it was interesting to see how the staff and management responded to the alarms and fire department's arrival.  Aliza and Bobby provided great service.  Both have great customer service skills and made an effort to connect with the guests at our table.  The restaurant decor itself is a little more toned down than most Red Robin locations.  The seating is a little close when the restaurant is full.  The outside seating looked inviting--we'll request outside seating when the location officially opens.

I'll have to be honest, it's been years since I last visited a Red Robin (Los Cerritos Center), the reason being, I normally like just getting my burgers quick (In N Out, Habit) and be on my way. Thanks to some Ventura County Yelpers, I was made aware that this location was doing a soft opening and was offering complementary meals to train their staff. Reservations (11AM) were made through RR's website (limit of 4 total per party), which connected to Yelp's reservations which made it quick and simple. Upon arrival, we signed in and was given a quick rundown on what we were going to receive. 1 unlimited drink (soda, coffee, iced tea), the entire party was allowed one Prime Rib dip (if anyone chose to have this) per the pamphlet given to us. Per our waitress Jennifer, we were allowed one appetizer or dessert for the table to share, 1 "Freckled Lemonade" (guess this is considered a speciatly drink and not a regular one?) and the servers were also allowed to give out one "premium" (Red Robin's Finest) per shift, and if a we wanted a milkshake, it depended on availability as they were making them at intervals. Luckily for us, one of the servers walking around with said limited milkshakes was passing by our table and offered us one and we accepted it. Another server was walking around offering bottomless fries, and we accepted that as well. Our group came to a consensus and we decided on an appetizer (instead of dessert) to share. We ordered the NachO.M.G. using the Ziosk ordering system (which is how you order and pay for your meal). Which allowed us to customize our order anyway we want (choose ingredients, addons, etc.). If you own any smart device, this should come second nature, if you don't, you may want to ask your server to show you how to use it. The nachos were good, but something about the chips (texture wise) was not what I'm used to. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't something that I'm familiar with. When it came to ordering our drinks and burgers, we did so through our waitress.  No one else in my party was interested in the Red Robin's Finest, so I decided to order one from there (as we were limited to 1). I ordered the Smoke & Pepper and added a sunny side up egg, and decided to upgrade my fries to Red's Chili Chili Cheese Fries (which has bacon? I'm not complaining about the bacon, but next time, I'll have to ask what comes with a Red's Chili Chili Cheese Fries). The bottom of the burger had a small pool of grease (wasn't drowning, but a good amount) that kind of softened the bottom of the bun, but wasn't a big issue. The thing that threw me off was from the pictures, you can see pickles on the burger, but if you look at the listing of ingredients, pickles isn't listed as an item. Which makes the burger a bit on the salty side (extra-sharp cheddar + bacon + pickles = a lot of sodium). Now if they used a pickle with a more reserved flavor, or even take it off, it would make the flavors mix better and the sodium levels wouldn't be too overwhelming. I also see a Smoke & Pepper ketchup (which I did see on the bottom of the bun, but it didn't have a strong presence). Small side note, the egg was supposed to be "Sunny side up", but was given to me "over easy" and the yolk was hard, so no yellow "nectar" to drape my patty with. Burger was good, just needed the small tweaks and would be something I order all the time. Service was unbelievably incredible (I just hope it stays that way once they open 9/5/16) as our drinks never sat empty for long, fries were flowing like it was going out of style, and they kept checking up on us if everything was satisfactory. The staff overall seemed ready, some more than others (associates with experience assisting in training of the new recruits), but none of them seemed like a "fish out of water". The only thing that I would say "needed work" was my brother ordered a Long Island and the bar was "swamped" and the drink took some time to get to us. Hey, they're learning, so I hope that the bar picks it up when they finally open up. Overall, the food + experience + customer service, I will be back and maybe try a different burger as well. Thank you Jennifer, Red Robin, and staff.

Horrible opening day.  Beginning to the check. First they didn't want to seat us outside because there was "too many of us", but really the didn't want to try. 6 of them were just huddled up socializing. Another host actually accommodated us. Waitress had us waiting on our drinks for about 15min when the tables that were seated after us had their beer and icecream ready.. We had asked for waters and sodas.  Came back multiple times after we had ordered to ask what cheese, type of plate, or if we wanted it rare or well done.. Didn't get our sauces for our food, finished our plates before they even came back with bbq sauce or ranch.. Was pretty decent on making sure we kept getting our refills on our drinks, but not our fries.. SAM the manager was awesome. He came to us after and listened to us. Just so he can adjust for next time. And Made sure we got our rewards. Two stars for him, -3 for the service.

Went to the sneak peak Saturday. Everybody was very friendly & attentive. Service was superb & food was excellent. I was able to try different menu items I had not tried before. I will defiantly be back to this location.

This place was packed....but our server John took very well taken  care of... the food was great and the sense of urgency  was there when they forgot to get us one thing.. we 4 waiters try to brings us the stuff that  was forgotten.. but all in all the resturant  was awsome and the waiter John was kool and totally awsome.
Ok went in today ate with my daughter the food is really good the service was slow but I understand because they just opened and everybodys learning so very understandable I will be back

Got there on time, no wait time which was great. Took my boss and husband with me, service was flawless, and quick, food was delicious like always. A lot of trainees, hopefully they are taught the difference between rare, medium well, and we all done, Instead of pink no pink which is a bit confusing. Other than that we give thumbs up That you for the wonderful food.
Had no issues at all. Service was great. Bar was very nice. Burger was excellent. Fries are so so. Burgers are a bit pricey to be honest. Good choice of beers and plenty of tv for football.

Came here on the second day of the Grand Opening had a juicy Burger and juicy Fries. BBQ Sauce tasted homemade from scratch. It didn't taste Store bought. Servers were fast and friendly and very attentive. I would definitely come back.
Pretty crappy customer service.  Side note: Bottomless fries- because they only bring you 10-15 fries at a time. Why didn't they open an Island Burgers instead :( Very disappointed

After having a great massage at Massage Envy I walked over to Red Robin where my husband was having a beer waiting for me we had a great dinner. The place was hoping it was so busy. Every single employee had a great attitude. We had great garlic fries yum yum yum. They have a great dessert menu too!

All I can say is I just want my burger the way I ordered it and hot please! If you like the food and service at the Ventura location then try this one. Oxnard and Ventura red robins are just a pass for me. Then the manager of this store even attacked me as a person to my mother. Also this location states for every food allergy it takes 7 minutes extra (so hypothetically if you have 10 food allergies you will wait 70 minutes for your food) AKA they don't want your business if you want any substitutions to your food.  However, if you love the stellar food and and amazing service of the Thousands Oaks location then stay on the 101 until you make it to the T.O. Red Robin. If you venture out that way ask for Cody he is my favorite waiter but they are all great servers!! The food is even worth the drive because it's right and hot the first time around.  NOTE: to everyone reading the reviews for the "soft opening" on opening day. My family went over that day. They were told it was for friends and family of that red robin location only for opening day.

Our experience was great. Specially with our amazing server. She was super helpful and was super patient with my son, also since my parents decided to come join my son and I last min.  My mom n dad orders took a while to get to our table. We all ordered burgers and fries. My son and I ordered first and came our rather quick. There's my mom n dads order who arrived about 10 mins after we ordered. Their order took about 30-40mins.  Over all food and service was still excellent! Restaurant is new and clean.

Server was friendly but service was slow. The wait time just for water & soda was about 10 minutes. I ordered the whisky burger and it was good. I was excited about the bottomless fries, but ended up disappointed. Not only were the fries hard, but they only give you a handful of fries with every refill.

Our server Rica provided our table with five-star service. This review is for the food quality only, as the host and hostess and the serving staff were exceptional.  The quality of the food we were served belonged to a one-star establishment.  Sombrero salad: lettuce was warm and wilted. It tasted as if it had come from a bag of store bought pre-washed salad that had been left to sit out in the sun all day. We ordered two of these and they came out different from each other, and both were quite pathetic looking. It appeared as if someone in the kitchen had just randomly thrown a bunch of lettuce onto a plate, added a few black beans to it and attempted to decorate this combo with some avocado and a thin slap of chicken breast. Both salads came out without salad dressing, when one had been ordered with and the other without dressing.   The house salads were of similar sad condition: warm and wilted. How anyone could mess up a house salad was beyond me.  The fries were cold and hard.  The burgers were NOT "gourmet" as claimed on the menu. The patties were thin and tasted like those frozen patties that you would get from a lazy and simple back yard family BBQ. Whoever had prepped the food couldn't even get the sauces right: the steak sauce on the burgers ended up to be a BBQ sauce.  I had never seen my always-extremely-proper-in-public mother so upset over her food before.  First, she had had to wait close to an hour for her salad.  Then she was served such low quality food. And when she found out that the salad was close to $11, she mumbled angrily under  her breath for the remainder of our visit.  And if I were to transcribe what she had said abut her food, I would have to bleep most of it out. She even left the restaurant early because she felt cheated.  Rica did ask Manager Sandy to see us about our disappointment with the food. Sandy did explain to us about the entire kitchen staff being brand new and that the restaurant was still training its staff. She did remove the Sombrero salads from our bill.  I am going to keep my one-star rating for this establishment because the food was so bad. I will give it another chance in a month or so, and hope that all the kitchen staffing issues will have been worked out by then.

Horrible!!! If only you could give no stars.  First off: going here I understood that it was a new restaurant and a lot of people would be there. The front staff were terrible. We got there at 740 and were told that it would be 30-35 minute wait. After about 35 minutes we started seeing groups going before us and hadn't waited more than 5-10 minutes. We had a group of 8 two of the groups that came after us had 7. They continued to tell us that we had too large of a group and they were having trouble getting a table ready for us. Well then how were u able to get two groups of 7 before us... After close to an hour we finally decided to leave. When we told the front stuff they proceeded to make a few rude comments towards us. Unfortunately I could not find the manager to file a complaint and was not willing to search any longer for her. It sucks because we go to the Ventura one all the time and like the manager, she would have been very upset to know what her staff was doing. But after an hour of waiting and many groups approximately our size going before us we left and went to lazy dog. I am currently here and they say is right away. Worst restaurant experience ever!!!

I came to this Red Robin the other day and a friend and I sat at the bar. It was really nice and it wasn't crowded as I expected it to be. The food was amazing and the server bartender was really nice. I do recommend the freckled lemonade with absolute, it was delicious and it was my first time trying it as well. We got the guac and chips I was kinda disappointed because there was only like a few chips but besides that they were good. Overall I gave the restaurant 5 stars because everything was great.

I waited a couple days to write this review to make sure it wasn't exaggerated due to frustration. The restaurant is clearly still in training mode evidenced by the numerous staff running all over the place. I was given a 20 minute wait at check in and it was on point. My server was courteous and did her job ok considering the staff chaos.  The one star rating is directly related to the quality of food which took about 40-45 minutes to arrive. My wife and sons ordered burgers which all came out just warm like they were sitting for a while. Soggy fries felt old or not cooked properly. Onion rings were not fully cooked and drenched in oil. I ordered a beer a little after sit down but that took about 30 minutes to arrive as well.  Here's the really bad part. We ordered the chicken fingers and fries for our daughter which came out late with the other food. My wife is used to opening/cutting the chicken open to cool down to eating temperature. Upon doing this she noticed the chicken was completely raw. I mean totally pink and uncooked as if it was just taken out of the refrigerator/freezer. I wish I would have taken a photo for this review. We were absolutely shocked and disgusted. My daughter had almost bitten it to that. We all lost our appetite after seeing this. We called our server who apologized, took it back and ordered a replacement. The manager came over and apologized and made the lame excuse of the cook probably putting the food in the wrong fryer? I would have expected more of a concern with seriously raw food being served. Whatever the reason that cook has absolutely no business in the kitchen and should be fired. I hope no one has fallen victim to food poisoning by this place. I would stay away until they hopefully get their act together and hire the right staff/cooks.

The new red robin is horrible I will never eat here again my service sucked my waiter was horrible didnt smile never checked on us my food was cold and to top it off came and told us our food will be out soon that were not the only ones waiting then went to the table behind us and told that family the same thing all I hear the family say was how is that if u haven't even taken our order....wooowwww I'll stick with ventura location they have great customer service and friendly staff....

Service was pretty good, and they all did their jobs well. I left them a decent tip. My complaint was about the manager. All I asked for was a dessert. Made a comment about my calories and I assume was making a joke. I am not laughing thought the manager was very rude. Be forwarned.

This new place sucks! We were seated at the bar area and it was small and crowded, such a tight squeeze when trying to sit. Our waiter was very friendly forgot her name though. I came with my bf and he didn't receive the correct meal he ordered! Btw we over heard a couple next to us and their order was messed up too! Looked like they got ours instead...The taste of the food wasn't the same...I honestly would of rather go to the ventura one lol! Now let me talk to you about why I also give this place one star rating! The UTENSILS! As I grabbed a fork for my boneless wings I noticed one the knives had red stuff on it, I take a closer look and it wasn't CLEANED at all!!! I was so disgusted!! I should've took a pic of it...You'd think for it being a new place everything would be in tip top shape! But it wasn't! Never going back to that Red Robin again!
We have been here twice and each time to food and service were top notch. The patio gets a bit windy, but other than that, no complaints.
The service is not good! We ordered a burger with some pink, and it was literally bleeding, we ordered the mac&cheese burger barely had any mac & cheese on it.

Our service was ehhhh...not impressive at all!  Our server Brian had a slight attitude with anything we asked to start off with.  We were seated in a timely fashion, our food was good with the exception of when the food arrived to our table we were left for a good 15 mins with no waiter comping by to bring utensils so we just sat and stared at our food.  Finally, when he did circle back we requested more "bottomless fries" and it's going on about 20mins and still no fries.  Side note...the hostess blowing up balloons in the entry is incredibly annoying and loud!  Not impressed!
Food was cold  My chicken was bloody  My bf got a "royal" burger it's advertised with egg yolk and got hard boiled egg  They took 19 min to make an over easy egg Won't come back

I've been there 4 times since they opened and it is always freezing in there.  Service is good but 3 out of 4 times they were confused as to who was bringing us food.  Tonight, 2 burgers were wrong but they corrected it and comped our bill.  The ice tea is weak and requires ALOT of sugar!!!  The fries are hot, rest of food was warm.  We usually go to Ventura Red Robin.  Not too impressed with this new location yet..  Our servers have always been awesome, just need to work on speed and follow thru..

Our friend told us it was bad service to begging but we didnt listen to her and went to try it out ourselves. Honestly a hole in the wall Mexican restaurant would've had better service than them. The server had no cash on him. The manager lied about giving us a discount because we waited 45 minutes for our drinks, 15 minutes for our food.  The silverware was dirty meaning their dishwasher wasn't working or is weak. And there was half a stale chip in my friends blt. Good luck on eating here.

The worst red robin I've ever been to.The Oxnard location was horrible! I ordered a ghost burger and they didn't put and lettuce, tomato like they usually do. Then I asked for both and onions. When I got my burger back there Was no onions and the patty inside was BITTEN!!!!There was clearly 2 bite marks on one of the small thin parties!!! So gross! I called the manager over and she apologized and said that all of the staff was new. She comped my meal. I ate fries.

We had the worst service tonight! People at several tables around us, who came in after we ordered, received their food before we did. It took so long we had to ask several times what happened. It turned out that they were holding the food that was ready in the back until all orders were done. When it did come it was cold. I was not given what I ordered. Several others also received wrong orders. During the wait we were not given utensils or napkins so when the food came some of us couldn't eat. When I ordered I was asked if I wanted steak fries, garlic fries, or sweet potatoes fries without mentioning there was an upcharge. I won't come again. If Brian is your waiter you may want to change tables.

Went here for a quick lunch with the family. And let me tell you something, if you're really craving for a burger drive a little further and go to In n Out. If you want a casual sit down, I would recommend Lazy Dog.  It's just, no. And no getting a "they just opened" pass does not count either.  ** Our "gourmet" burgers was bland and the patty was over cooked i.e. dry. ** unlimited fries isn't worth it because they give you an ittybitty basket and take forever to come back. It's also cold and soggy.  ** the $5 lemonade was tasty. But be warned that it's half ice, it is bottomless per the menu but like said above, server takes forever to come back. And even we said we wanted a refill, we never got one. ** spiral pasta from kids menu tastes like Prego sauce no kidding.  Over all, a $50 bill for something so underwhelming, we could have taken our business somewhere.

The menus were greasy like someone had sprayed them with Pam, wich is off-putting. The hostess and our server were friendly and attentive. Our fries were cold and undercooked. The silverware AND plates were dirty. I'll give them a year to iron out their back of house issues and try again then.

I LOVE RED ROBIN! I have always had great memories of this chain restaurant ever since I started being a patron living in Santa Barbara. Thank goodness they still don't disappoint. Red Robin by all means is not fine dining, but I know exactly what I'm going to get each time. This new location is no different. Good service, fun atmosphere, good burgers & sandwiches, bottomless fries, unbelievably good lemonade & other refillable drinks & the best dressing, the poppy seed honey mustard! I ordered the new Mac & Cheese dish with a side salad, my sister had a black bean burger, my BF got a chicken sandwich & my nephew got the new Mac n cheese burger. EVERYTHING WE ORDERED WAS DELICIOUS!  The waiter was nice enough to consistently fill our glasses with our drinks & brought us our baskets of fries & more sauce.  LOVE THIS PLACE! I'm coming again.
I gave this place 4 stars only because my cheese on my burger wasn't melted enough than I was expecting. Other than that our server Jessica was awesome. I'm impressed she knows all the beers on tap!

I was excited that this Red Robin had finally opened so that I didn't have to drive all the way to the Pacific View Mall in Ventura--I know, lazy -__- We were greeted by the host who spoke REALLY fast--I could barely understanding anything he was saying, but, I managed to get by because I figured he was asking the usual questions when receiving guests *shrugs*  While we waited for our server, I was reading reviews on this location and read that the service was bad...We noticed that the table adjacent to us had not yet been cleaned up from the previous party of what seemed like 7 or 8 people.  Anyhow, our server, Kristy, was the absolute best!  I'd like to say she was probably the only person ACTUALLY working in the place besides the kitchen staff... We ordered appetizers through the tablet majigger.  It wasn't until after we had received our appetizers that someone was finally cleaning up the table adjacent to us.  But then, we soon realized it was because the bus boy actually was just talking to another employee sitting in the booth behind us (she must have been on break or just getting off work).  He literally half-assed  cleaning up the plates and was just making even more of a mess by spilling half the leftovers onto the floor.  Then, here comes our server Kristy, and helps him out!  She even asked for his rag because he was going to leave the mess on the chairs--instead, she cleaned up the rest of the table for him while he chatted with the nearby female employee! As we waited for our food, another male employee came to talk to the same off-duty employee.  From what he was loudly yelling as he walked away from the employee (we kinda had to stop talking because we couldn't hear ourselves over his yelling), he's trying to hook up with one of her friends or something and he told her to be secretive about it and a good wingman.  Well, okay, good luck bro--I think maybe you should be a little more discreet if you want to keep this a secret! Our food came out good--'twas delish!  Red Robin never lets me down.  Kristy even came to check on us a few times and was so attentive to EVERYONE she was serving!   Then, a different employee comes to sit and talk to the same off-duty employee still sitting in the booth. We also noticed several employees exiting to the side patio to eat, hang out, and take smoke breaks.   The food was great.  Our server was amazing (we were really lucky to get her).  I'm only giving it 3 stars because the people who were supposed to be working kind of ruined the dining experience since it was so noticeable that only our server was working while they lollygagged.

I came here for lunch with my daughter.  The silverware was gross asked for new stuff and it too was dirty. We used the lemon out of the lemonade to clean the forks. Then I realize wait, we're having burgers..... no fork needed dodged a bullet. lol.  Ordered lemonade and got a strawberry one which I didn't want and got charged for it. Our server Gabe provided our table with great service. I ordered the Smoke & Pepper It was topped with scrawny black-pepper bacon not like in the picture that's for sure. It came with extra-sharp Cheddar on a toasted ciabatta bun with house-made Smoke & Pepper ketchup The meat was not med rare but still juicy. My daughter got the Teriyaki Chicken with a perfectly grilled chicken breast, teriyaki, grilled pineapple, melted Swiss, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo. she ate the whole thing plus two rounds of bottomless fries. The restaurant is well decorated the service and the staff was great just think they need to step up the food game a bit.

The food wasn't bad at all! The service on the other hand was pretty poor. My father in law had a terrible experience. He order chili, the chili came with no spoon. By the time he had gotten the spoon the chili was cold. There's more but I can't fully remember. My husband and I went on our own. First a waiter told us he'd be right back to take our drink order. Mmmm maybe 5-10 minutes later our waiter asked if we'd been helped. My husband ordered a burger and fries. He requested fries before the burger because we hadn't eaten since earlier in the day, he received them with his burger. I ordered a salad with no tomatoes. I received my salad with tomatoes and no silverware I had to ask for silverware. My husband wanted to enjoy more fries with his burger. The waiter walked by twice without stopping by our table. My husband had to use the machine to request the waiter to come by our table. We had a very simple order in my opinion but kinda took a while. My husband and I will be driving to the Ventura location next time. Sorry not sorry. The waiters don't seem to care to keep their guest happy.

RR Gourmet Burgers and Brews?!? Well, if you are looking for tasty burgers then, this is NOT the place. Not mentioning the hour wait! My burger was supposed to be their "finest", lol.  Bland, over cooked, no flavor and soul... and their brew selection was very disappointing.!  What a shame!

The only reason I gave this place a 1 star is to submitt review or else it would get none! This place is horrible and trashy and doesnt belong in riverpark! It looked like a friday night at chuckee cheeses. Looks like they havnt vacccumed in a week! Decor is horrible! Was seated right away but waited over 45 min for food. Never received my salad after 30 minutes so canceled that. After asking whats taking so long they said just waiting on 1 more plate. Few minutes later which was almost an hour now from sitting I got up to leave with my kids and they brought the food. We decided to  stay cause kids were tired and hungry, Bad idea! the food was Disgusting. Messed up on order, lettuce on burger was wilted and sogg when I asked for no lettuce to begin with, spoke with mngr and she said chefs were having issues which makes it no excuse. She replaced burger and it was charcoaled burnt. My son spit it out.  Grilled cheese sandwhich was cold and hard. We ended up calling it a loss and left. There was nothing else I can do after bringing it up to mngr who had zero personality. Upon leaving we heard others complaining to mngr and to waiters that their food was unacceptable! Glad it wasnt just me that complained!  It was horrible and the tension of everyone upset in their made it uncomfortable. I will NEVER return to this location. Ventura may get packed but way better service and food! Dont waste ur time at this location. Its nothing nice and dont know who hired those "chefs" but they need to take a second look or that place will end up like toby keiths, shut down after a month! Save ur money! Id rather eat Mcdonalds!
I couldn't have been more satisfied with the service it complimented my food well. I really enjoyed the avalanche desert. Thanks so much Jessica great service and Jessie thanks for the laughs.
if i could give this zero stars.. i would. shit service. the employees made fun of my back brace that i am currently using to heal from a car accident, would not recommend.

My wife and I were shopping at Target. As we are walking back to our car we decide to get a bite to eat at this Red Robin. It's 5PM on a Saturday.  We are seated right away,  Ordered 2 appetizers and drinks,  my wife orders the Wedgie Burger and I order the Barbecue Chicken Salad. The appetizers arrive,  not hot but not cold, be we eat them. When the meal comes out, they bring a Veggie Burger and my salad. My wife refused the Veggie Burger and tells the person she ordered a WEDGIE BURGER. He says he'll get it fixed. 10 minutes later the Managers comes to our table and explains the difference between the 2 burgers like my wife is stupid... I had to raise my voice a little to let her know that we know what we ordered, and she should get in the kitchen and have them fix my wife's order..They had not started my wife's meal yet... I start to eat my salad only to notice that the lettuce was brown and wilted, finally the burger shows up, and I point out the brown lettuce to the manager. She comps the meal...  We left $2 on the table and walked out.

Sandy and Marvee were amazing and so was the rest of the staff. Very fast and efficient with my party of 15! Everything was spot on and perfect. I would definitely recommend here for any big parties you may have! Awesome job Red Robin staff!

Called to place a phone order ... Brian answered the phone, told me he would be back in a Second .... was on hold for 11 minutes and no one ever came back. I love you Red Robin ....  but that's freaking ridiculous.

Growing pains! The server was a sweet girl! Tipped her 28% bc it was NOT her fault but the kitchen's fault. Appetizers, Drinks and Desert orders are able to be made on an ipad looking device on the table. Placed an order for Mint Chocolate Chip Shake and some options popped up we had to wait for the server yo answer. Ie: Malt, split or whipped. what's the difference...the ipad can't  tell me. Next we ordered the onion rings full stack. Again the ipad had special sauce or ranch. We didn't want ranch but 2 of the special sauce. Had to wait to tell the server that we didnt want the ranch and she said she will tell the kitchen. The kitchen didnt listen to the server. Appetizers came out and we went to eat and whoops no silverware. Server asked how is everything was tasting and I replied...well we haven't eaten yet bc we have no silverware. She apologized. We ordered 2 classic burgers. One kids cheeseburger with fries and the other cheeseburger with black pepper bacon. Well apparently the kitchen lost our ticket order bc it never came out. We literally sat there for about 30 mins with our appetizers, water and lemonade done when I stopped the server and asked to check the status of our entrees. Took her about 10 minutes to coke back and she looked flustered on the verge of tears and really disappointed. She said there was a mishap in the kitchen and the manager is going to speak with us and offered anything else in the meantime which we denied bc we would not have room for our entree. Manager came out 7 mins after and apologized and said they are remaking our burgers and would comp us our meal. 20 mins later our food arrived. Kids cheeseburger had no cheese and my black pepper bacon cheeseburger had no black pepper bacon. At this point, we didnt want to send it back, so we laughed about it. New establishment with new employees need more training overall. Give this place about a year and everything will run smoothly. The entrées that we were comped, we gave back in tip. Wasn't the servers fault and no need to penalize her for a subpar standard kitchen.

We went here last night. The two stars are for the friendly service. I was really excited to have this place in Oxnard. However, I will not return for maybe a couple of years. Everything felt very dirty. The food was nothing impressive. They were nice enough to deliver our bottomless fries early. Unfortunately, the fries looked like tidbits that they'd picked off of someone else's leftover plates. I had high hopes for this place, but was very disappointed.
The worst service ever!!!!!  If you have 3 hours to spare then it's the place to go.  All our orders were incorrect!

I had the worst experience here. It took an hour and a half to get the food, they kept forgetting our order, messed up my drink, and then I had something in my drink, and I'm pretty sure our server had a few drinks himself. In addition to that it was like pulling teeth to pay our bill. Save yourself the time and go to in n out.
Horrendous service. Long waits due to kitchen not prepared and can't keep up. Empty tables yet 30 min wait. Sad. Don't come. Too many other better choices nearby.

Red Robin was always one of my favorite restaurants I would always go to go one at the mall and was excited when they brought one to the collection I have now been there three times and each time just getting worse and worse. I went and had dinner a couple of nights ago and ordered the whiskey river BBQ wrap and French onion soup. The soup was so salty it taste like ocean water, so they brought me chicken tortilla soup which wasn't good, then I asked for extra well done chicken in my wrap took a bite and it was slimy, my sister ordered a salad and it was hot and soggy and nothing like described on their menu. The ladies room was full of trash and bloody tissue on the floor, not sanitary at all and didn't look like it was clean in awhile. The service was slow and one of the managers and about 4 other employees were sitting in a booth being loud not paying attention to anyone, worst restaurant experience I've had, then to top it off as soon as I got home ( I live a street away) I started puking. Worst service and food poisoning.

I am quite surprised at the poor reviews.  I had nothing but a positive experience from the time I walked in the door.  After the wait staff learned I was a Veteran, the level of service did feel like it went up a notch, but I didn't feel it was necessary as my experience already was that the customer service was very good.  The food was what I expected from previous Red Robin experiences.  I also didn't experience any delays and they were quite busy as they were recognizing visiting Veteran's with a free meal.  I'll be back.

The reviews are right.. the service here is horrible. Ate here last night, couldnt get the appetizer we wanted to order because the kitchen was out of it. No big deal, except the fact that getting that information was like pulling teeth with our server, Joshua. He seemed to have no idea what he was doing, didnt seem to understand how to navigate through the little ipad on the tables either, great cause neither did we -_- Food took FOREVER. Tables seated after us received their food before we did. Made a small request for an added side of cheese dip for my fries, our server replied back "uh we have ketchup or ranch" ... i replied back "no, i said cheese"  didnt know a request like that was rocket science. Low and behold my long awaited order comes, and no side of cheese dip! Go figure it was still added to our bill though, no worries i had that removed right around the same time i decided i was not going to tip.Not spending my hard earned money on a crappy dinner, with crappy food, crappy service, and still going to tip.... We wont be back. This is more than just growing pains for a new restaurant......

Mike was great tonight.  Busy and he took excellent care of us even though super busy.  Steven took care of us last week and was also great.  Dyana at the bar on the weekend was also very nice and helpful.  Even in tough situations the service was good
Food was pretty good but the restaurant itself is so small it gets pretty loud. Our server however was very nice and enthusiastic

Management allowed patrons to sit at the bar cussing and using foul language. It was very offensive and the manager and bartender should have asked them to refrain from such language. They were acting as if they were in a sports bar not a family restaurant.

Late dinner...wait time was 15 minutes not bad at all,our waiter was good,we got our drinks pretty quick.we ordered our food and got it fast aswell.i ordered the mac and cheese hamburger with bottomless fries for 6.99 you cant beat that.the burger was a little in the dry side if you asked me the sweet potatoe fries where on point,i will return as the price is right and is conveniently located near me...our bill for 4 meals with drinks and a tip for $45.

The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is because this place is new and that's probably the only reason it's not a dump yet. Went to meet some friends for a drink and some food the other night. You'd expect a place that has brews in their title to have more than just the generic stuff you can get at any vons. If I wanted to drink water, I'd just go pick up a case of bud light at the store. The burger wasn't awful. But I'd rather go across the freeway and get 3 burgers at inn n out for the same price. Also, it's not hard to offer bottomless fries when you only bring 8 fries out at a time.

Went there on a Thursday evening. Staff was nice but seemed disorganized. Ordered drinks and then waited 10 minutes for them to come . Ordered meal not from waitress but had to get hors douerves from a computer screen on table. When food came in asked for water and butter. Manager, Asst manager dropped by to see  if we needed anything. Would many people we wanted butter but never sure if anyone took responsibility.  onion soup too salty. Clam chowder starchy thick with no cream or milk. Pretzel bites good. Hamburger good. Veggie burger ok.  So so experience and a little price

The food was ok but the restaurant was  **FILTHY!!**  I nearly left before we were gotten drinks because the restaurant was so trashed. The table behind us was empty and hadn't been bussed before we got there and stayed dirty after we left. There was trash and bits of food all over the ground. It was not that busy at all for a Saturday night at 9:45.  Servers were confused about orders and they took the totally wrong order to the table next to us. Servers also did that thing where they take our order and then mysteriously disappear for 15 minutes. That happened twice. Again, it was not that busy. Two servers, each had probably 3 tables. It was also really annoying how long it took to get a refill of fries and my soda, since my server was nowhere to be found. The only reason this wasn't 1 star is because the food was fine I guess. Nothing too special but it tasted good and was made correctly at least.  Still, don't know if I want to give this place another shot, certainly not in that condition. Probably the filthiest restaurant I've ever dined at.

Came here on Black Friday when the shopping mall was close to closing time. My friends and I decided to go here since it looked like there was no wait. We got seated 15 minutes later and thought the service was going to be great as we got greeted by almost every employee that passed by us and the manager was walking around checking up on tables making sure everything was ok. Well, I was wrong... *they forgot my garlic fries, my friend got his and I waited 5-10 minutes later *my friend's water had something floating in his cup *service was slow *we had to ask for a to go box twice

I cannot put no stars so 1 it is!!! Wow I phoned in over 1 hour ago two burgers and a salad not a huge complicated order!! Still not ready this is the 2nd time we tried it! The first time I was on hold for 7 mins I hung up called again waited 4 more mins then called the Ventura location!!! Go to Ventura this location sucks the management should be fired to be honest way to many complaints!!

My classmates and I decided to come here for their juicy burgers and "bottomless" french fries. We got seated right away in a booth during a weekday lunch hour.  I ordered the whiskey bbq burger (delish!) with a small side of steak fries. I just wish the restaurant would pile the fries more so that we wouldn't have to call their attention for more fries because they're "bottomless." Even when we get the next plate of french fries, it's not a whole lot either :( A big plus is that you can split the bill among yourselves with the machine that accepts credit cards at your table easily. Don't forget to sign up for the red robin loyalty rewards so you get free goodies like a free milkshake :)

Portions versus value is extremely poor! Their cups of soup are more like a thimble full of soup - give me a break as if they aren't already making sinfully outrageous profit. The so-called bottom-less garlic fries are a joke. You pay the extra cost for the fries but no one comes around to offer you any refills - a profit tool by design. The service was terrible, they couldn't have been 10% full in off lunch hours. The waiters need to focus on customer service than pleasing their over-bearing store managers regarding skimpy portion control and worrying about margin and profitability! Stick to the basics. Provide great tasting food at reasonable prices and the profitability will follow. Don't just walk away from this place...RUN LIKE HELL!

Red Robin is one of our favorite places to eat for a nice, casual dinner.. But the services here is horrible, we got seated right away...but we waited a while to order our drinks and food, and on top of that waited even longer to get our food. By the time we got our food my husbands burger was soggy and cold and my sandwich was cold as well...my daughter waited longer than we did to get a simple apple juice... The server, never stop by to refill our drinks...when we were done with our food, we asked for a drink and garlic fries to go...the drink was brought in a regular cup, not, a to-go cup...the manager came up to our table we made him aware of the situation and he made the excuse, "they were backed up on the orders of fries, because they only had two frying baskets", and again he brought out a regular basket of fries.  This is our second time here and both times the service was very bad.   I got to say, I don't think we will be coming back here again.

The only reason why I'm giving it a 1 star rating is because Yelp doesn't have a 0 star choice. Worst experience at a Red Robin ever! Been to this new Red Robin a few times and it has not improved at all! Last night we ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it was cold! The drinks took forever to come. My wife's food came out before everyone else's so she had to wait for us so we can all eat together. I ordered a burger and was asked how I like it, I said slight pink and they served it rare. My son ordered the kids meatballs and they brought it to him last and without the cheese dip, he actually had to wait almost 5min and we had to remind the waitress. My daughter ordered the kids pizza and she got a cold pizza, to go with her cold drink. The bottomless fries are a damn joke, they never come back so you don't get shit anyway. Obviously management needs work cause they have no clue how to run a restaurant. The cooks need help in the kitchen or Red Robin should invest in cooking appliances so the food can actually come out warm. Don't waste your time at this Red Robin, I know it's convenient for us that live here in Oxnard but I rather drive to Ventura or even Thousand Oaks. This place sucks! Plus there's plenty of good places to eat in the area. Take your business somewhere else.

Been here 3 or 4 times now. Today was the best yet.  Great service, not just from our server, but the whole team.  We never ran out of tea or lemonade. Food was served quickly and was hot and as ordered. Onion rings went great with my patty melt. My wife's BLTA was perfect as well.  Much better than Lazy Dogs.

If I could give this a zero I would. This is my second time coming and it was worst then the last time I came. It took about fifteen minutes for the waitress to even take our order. It then took her 10 minutes to bring us our drinks and the fries she offered never arrived. The food took 45 minutes  to arrive and we had to ask for every refill and every order of bottomless fries. The kiosk was not working so we pushed the call server button, I had five servers look my way and ignore me. I finally had to raise my hand to get someone to notice me. I would avoid this place and chose any other restaurant!

1 hour wait for my food to get here. Worst service yet, very disappointed, if you like red robin i recommend going somewhere else besides the collection.....unless you like waiting 40 minutes or more for your food, the time i spent waiting i saw 3 couples leave. Never coming here again?

Unfortunately,  service here is horrible. I have been there 3 times and had bad service! I prefer the one in Ventura or go around the corner and go to In and out. I was there on a Friday night, about 10 pm. There were three tables with very few customers. we were seated at a dirty booth. I had to request them to clean it, the girl was upset as she walked to get a wet rag that was dripping with water. She wiped it and left it very wet; both table and seat! I asked her for napkins so I can dry it and again walked away upset. I should had known better. We finally ordered chix nuggets, a grilled cheese, and 2 waters....40 minutes later. The chicken was raw, you could see the blood and the grilled cheese was floating in butter/ oil... the most disgusting meal ever!  I complained to one of the managers who explained that the 2 managers were in the back "cooking" the food. We weren't given any utensils nor napkins. I finally explained to one of the managers who swore I had ordered 19 minutes ago, then it was discovered that the young waitress had forgotten to place the order.  HORRIBLE  and it was empty.

Was told I would be contacted about the poor service we recieved within 2-3 business days of my review. Been almost a month. Still waiting. Guess I shouldn't expect much. Let alone a refund for the $78 we spent. Do not got to this location! Drive 10 mins up the 101 to the Ventura location or find anywhere else in the Collection to eat. Do not waste your time or money.

Took two hours to get mac and cheese, and thirty minutes just get a box. Had to ask the manager to get a box since the server never came and checked on us. Don't plan to get on going back unless I have plans all day.

Typically I'm not a Red Robin customer, just not my thing. But I have to say this location has won me over!!  Staff is super, customer oriented. Kitchen staff does a good job. Drinks from the bar are generous.  Keep up the good work, see you on our next trip over.  Cheers!!

We decided to give the Red Robin's at the Collection a try. Friday night was about a 30 minute wait.  Once we were seated. Missy, our waitress took our drink order and asked about appetizers. We passed this time, put in our drinks and within a few minutes, our drinks came. We then ordered our meal, Burgers was the call of the night! Food came within 15 minutes and was nice and hot.  We spoke to the Manager, Angie, who was super cool and appreciated the feedback. Overall, a good meal for a fair price and nice atmosphere!

What a disaster. Arrived at 7PM. Ordered at 7:15PM and by 8:00PM, one of our orders came out and the other was, "delivered to another table." We told them to cancel our order. It's no wonder this location is the worst reviewed in the area. Our experience tonight is no exception. Come here if you don't want to eat, but instead, hear them blow up balloons all night. In-N-Out here we come!

I read the reviews before we went here and I thought 'people just have really high expectations for a brand new place' that wasnt the case.  We live in Riverpark and this was our first trip. We went at 3pm on New Years. There were two of us, the hostess seemed concerned eith seating even though i saw a lot of empty place , she walked us to the bar and asked if we minded sitting at the cocktail tables. I assumed there was have been a party going to take all the available tables and so i agreed to climb my hard to miss pregnant bump onto the high seats.  I immediately excused myself to use the restroom but the waiter stopped me on my walk back and asked me what he could get me to drink. I had no idea what I wanted but he had stopped me so I said a lemonade. Whe I looked at their options I changed my mind and ordered the drink I wanted when he returned. This was ny only issue with the server besides this he was awesome. I ordered a sandwich my husband ordered a burger with things added for extra and no tomato no mayo. He got the upgraded fries. The server checked in with us a few times and was very friendly. He updated us on the timing of the food.  When our order arrived I got what I had ordered my husband got a burger with tomato and a different extra then what he had requested. The fries were also not the upgraded one. The server noticed the fries right away before we even said anything and he brought them to the table. Since we were hungry we decided not to say anything about the burger since I did not want to wait to have it fixed.  When I paided I noted that the server had inputed everything we had ordered correctly however this was clearly an issue in the kitchen and the person who ran the food not checking before delivering it.  When there are so many other options in The Collection to eat/drink/watch sports why would we go to a place who cant get our food right?  First and last trip there -Riverpark Resident

Kristy was our waitress and she hustled and bustled to make to keep up with our demands. Even though we were in a hurry and they were busy, she did her very best to make sure we were happy. Manager also. Checked in on us. Maybe they saw the other negative reviews and are reacting, but I would say give them a chance. If you're not happy, talk to a manager, they want us happy (a rule of thumb that has never hurt me), as new locations get murdered by silent disprovals that vocalize on here after the fact. I hope others that had a good experience take the time to review (as it's generally bad experiences that get people to post reviews).

Went in today and when we sat down, my party and I were informed by our waitress that some items on the menu were not available because they had been busy and ran out of those items. We understood and were not bothered by it because it didn't affect what we were going to order. We ordered out food and the waitress told us our food would be out shortly. Once the food came out, everything seemed to be okay expect the chicken tenders (what they call Clucks & Fries) I had ordered. They didn't inform us that they had ran out of chicken tenders and instead cooked a chicken patty, cut it up into four thin pieces and severed me that. I asked our waitress if these were supposed to be the tenders or if they had ran out of them and decided to serve me this. She told me that she was not aware of what had happened and went back to see if they had served me this because they ran out tenders. I didn't want to be rude and send it back, or order something new and let the "chicken tenders" go to waste because food is food but overall, I was really disappointed with the fact that they decided it was okay to make a makeshift version of what I ordered without first informing me, the customer, that what I had ordered was not available.

I am sorry, but this will not be a great review. I have been to other Red Robins and they are pretty good. This location, I tried 3 times and I will NOT go back again. Wait was too long for everything. After we sat down, they took our order quick, but the drinks and food took almost 50 minutes to come. They did not give us napkins or utensils. I had to go and ask the front desk hostesses. And that still took sometime. By the way, our server was great and sweet. It was not her fault. My friend had something in her burger. So we sent it back. The manager came and apologize. And he was very nice about it. My friend did not eat. When they asked for more Fries, I said yes. That never came.m. They still messed up our bill and even we asked for separate checks, they still got it wrong. We sent it back, and they kind of forgot about us. We had kids with us and it was getting late, so We had to get up from our chairs and start walking out the door to get their attention. I told my friend: "You know, forget our credit cards, let's go." Partial serious. I was not as upset as my friend. I am sorry to see a brand new location (few months open) now, can not carry the traffic, customer service and quality. But you be the judge. Give them the chance. I did it 3 times and I am done!

Pros: the cheeseburgers are pretty good and the quality of the beef was excellent. Cons: every drink at our table was sent back because they had no alcohol in them..I'm talking 4/5 drinks. Orders and drinks took an inordinate amount of time to reach us. 20 minutes for a beer?  Why did we need a Red Robin in Oxnard? There's one just up the 101 at the mall, 5/10 minutes away.  Yardhouse or Lazy Dog are both way better choices than Red Robin, better food, drinks, and service.

Went to this place tonight with my family for the first time and we loved it. This is a new location. We frequent the one in Ventura. I am glad this one opened. It was quite busy but still a few empty tables. I cannot say enough about the staff. From the greeters, host/hostess, waitress and managers. They were all friendly and made everyone feel welcomed. They were going to each table making sure all needs were met. Our server Angel was very nice and attentive. Katherine came over to explain the rewards program and once I enrolled I received a free seasoning shaker. Then Sarah came by a manager she was also very friendly and sociable and knew sports. She talked to my son about baseball. The food was good. We ordered A1 burger, wedgie burger, and kids mini corn dogs. Everything was really good. They gave us the wrong burger for the wedgie burger they gave us a lettuce wrap. Once we complained they took it away and immediately the manger came and apologized and even took it off out bill. Thank you, Sam, it shows customer service is important to this business. We will be back!

Party of 18 for my daughters Birthday dinner was a mistake to go here! Way under staffed...Took us over an hour to get our food! Server was getting ready to run out and leave everything behind...No reservations taken so no guarantees of seating us all! Food was bland and fries were few per plate. Never again will I go in a large party! I was embarassed that it took so long to get drinks and food to everyone!
Good burgers, dependable, good fries and fish and chips. Line isn't too long and wait staff are pretty cool

The food is ok , but the service it's really bad and slow. Didn't get any drinks refill and I asked for more French fries and never got them. I like the one in Ventura it's way better in service and food . Last time coming here .

Let me start off by saying I LOVE Red Robins burgers!!!   BUT I will NEVER return to this location ever again!!  From the the moment we walked in, rhe histess was not very friendly.  It seems like the facr tjst we were gping to have a large party was going to be an inconvenience.  She said we need to make sure to let her because her manager needs to help set up the tables.  Just the way she said it.  Came in with a party of 12 to celebrate a family member's birthday.  They brought food to the table for ONLY half of our party & the other half had to wait 15 mins later.  Very upsetting considering that the first half waited for us to get our food & theirs got cold.  We immediately ordered extra fries as everyone runs out pretty quickly.  We finally got our extra fries 30 mins later & there were only a few fries on each one.  Took 30 mins to get refills.  And one person in our party didn't get her refill until she was done eating.  Again, we waited for our extra fries & instead got our checks.  WORST service I've ever received at a Red Robin.   To top it off.....our server brought the birthday girl her icecream & informed her that they were too busy to sing Happy Birthday to her!!  However, a short time later we heard them singing to someone else.  I guess we need to be in the bar section for that.  Boooo to you Red Robin in Oxnard!!!  Such a disappointment.  You just lost 12 loyal Red Robin customers! By the way waiter.....I'm STILL waiting on my campfire sauce that we asked 5x for!!!   We will stick with Ventura & Thousand Oaks!!!
My girlfriend and I came here for dinner. Nice new building, burgers were delicious and our server josh was on it. We will be coming back

If I could give this location a 0 stars, I would.  We have been here 6 times since it opened and every. single. time. our order has either been incorrect or inedible.  Once, when I sent my food back (after taking one bite of my sandwich and realizing they put mayo on it when I requested none) they literally walked into the back and then brought me back my same exact sandwhich. Today I had a free b-day burger so I decided to give it one last try and order it to go. Now I should have checked before I left..but really should I have to??  Guess what, my order was wrong.  Not wasting another penny at this location.

Im such a big fan of Red Robin however after visiting this location it has left a bad taste in my mouth. The hostess was extremely rude  and the service was horrible waited over 20 minutes before we even had anyone acknowledge us and another 10 mins before our drink order was even taken. We ordered appetizers and they arrived the same time as our dinner.i would definitely choose a different restaurant to eat at while at the collection.

I like my privacy this place was quiet and cool on a Monday Night.  We were seated by the host who was very cordial. He introduced us to Claudia who was Amazing (a delight) she took our order, brought us our drinks and swiftly handed us excellent customer service with a smile.  Not sure why everyone else had a bad experience. Must of not been their day. I was very pleased with the service.   I ordered the Turkey Burger protein style with steamed broccoli. I also ordered a Mojito.  Not Bad at All.  Come Visit Soon!  Don't hesitate to say hello if you see me!  Great Job Red Robin's of Oxnard keep up the good work. Sincerely Yelping, Bryan P.

Horrible.HORRIBLE. Once we were seated to our table, we noticed our table was pretty messy but we didn't say anything and just cleaned it ourselves.  They had left the utensils from the table before and left it there. After that, it Took 15 minutes for a server to come to our table. Our server Mike brought us dirty water that had red and white flakes in them. Another 15 minutes went by until he asked us what we wanted to order and once we told him the water was dirty, he took them away and never brought back new glasses of water??? But he came back 15 minutes later and told us he's leaving and another server will take our table. Our new server Jessica seemed so monotoned and uninterested. She seemed like she did not want to be here. Food came out pretty quickly. But overall such a horrible experience.
I found a hair. They were friendly... I feel like the food could have been way better

Staff needs to improve on customer skills and maybe provide more training to their servers. I did not appreciate the service received during my visit. Food took too long to get, I asked for a water and didn't get it till I finished my dinner. When we asked for a refill on our bottomless fries we got like 7 pieces of French fries for a table of 8. Aside from the service being totally disappointing the drinks were not what we expected. Ordered the vodka infused freckled lemonade and didn't even taste the vodka. Totally regret choosing this place for our family outing.

We love Red Robin, so we're happy one was a little closer. You walk in the double doors and the music is too loud. Once you get through the doors to the hostess check in, the music is not as loud.  Hostess was friendly, we were seated right away during lunch time. Our sever was friendly and efficient. We ordered 2 Banzai Burgers ( my favorite). The presentation looked good. But the tomatoes were very pale, and mushy. The burger just didn't taste like we remembered it. I had a side salad with balsamic dressing, and my husband ordered onion rings. The onion rings were very good they were breaded. My salad tasted moldy, I took one bite and left it. The red plastic plates they serve the food on, make it feel cheap. I'd rather have the red basket they used to use.  Unfortunately we won't be back, we were there 3 days ago, and I still can't seem to get that awful burger out of my mind- it just didn't taste right.  I usually will write a review good or bad immediately. But this one took me 3 days to get to it, I didn't want to bother, but it is still bothering me.

Ok, let me start by saying I don't like writing bad reviews, but can't help it in this case.  I really like Red Robin's and I was excited they came very close home. I decided to go on a not busy afternoon to avoid long waits. I got seated by the host and after 30 minutes no waiter/waitress.  I went back to the host and asked him if there was anyone on my section available and I knew from that moment on it was not going to be a good experience. I got the bottomless garlic fries with the pineapple burger. The food was good, but I couldn't ask for more than two times for the fries.  The waitress made it seemed like I was asking for the world.  The food was really good, the service and the wait was the reason for the 1 star.

This was the most pathetic experience I've had in a local restaurant for a Burger, A Burger!!! Oh, late lunch 2pm. Ordered draft beer, they don't have a cooler at the bar to chill the glasses, the beer was under temperature & flat. I'm just gett'in warmed up! My husband and I ordered our burgers, a long time went by as we drank our flat beer - we were giving them the benefit of the doubt, new place & all. Finally the burger's came, the runner had to stop our conversation to ask us who had what burger - really. We had to ask the bartender for napkins and a knife as well. And oh, we were at the bar with 2 other people and there were 5 other tables in the place. As I asked why I didn't have lettuce, my husband said OMG, WHAT THE F--- IS THIS?? He took the top of his bun off the burger and there sat what looked like a deep fried 1"x1" block of premi rubix cube... I called the manager over, he apologized and said he would remake the burger and what, wait another 25mins. At that point we were done and said we would pay for the flat beer. He did comp the check, but we were soooooo disappointed, appalled, and never going back to what felt worse than being in an Airport Restaurant waiting for a plane, only this time we couldn't forgive them because we weren't at an Airport waiting for a plane to Paris!!!!

Had the worst experience ever in this place!!! Warm flat beer. Slow Bartender. Managers look like they have been on 18 hour days since the 90's. And when our pathetic looking burgers FINALLY arrived, there was what I can only describe as a petrified sugar cube from Mesopotamia on top of it. I'm not one that ordinarily complains, but I have been a professional chef for 30 years and I honestly do not know what the F@#& that was. Tried to give the place a chance, it will Never happen again.

This was the 2nd time being to the oxnard location, and will never go back again. Both times the service is slow, our order was wrong.  The manager came to the table to let us know the kitchen was backed up, but apparently the kitchen, bar, napkins, and complete service was backed up!  We never were offered more fries, never got our 2nd order of drinks, could barely get napkins without having to ask 3 different people. Servers were standing by the kitchen, and at what point would you think maybe I should help somewhere so my customers could get served, that was to much thinking for them. I will not ever go to the oxnard location again, and I strongly recommend anyone who does, take a bag of snacks, because your appetizers, and meal will be awhile.

Bad service. Long wait for food order. The server came back and forth at least 5 times to say * your fried will be ready in a minutes* we finally left without the fried. Spent 2 hours in the restaurant for 2 burgers and the wings.
Went to eat there the place was empty could not get any service  what so ever pist me off never go back ghetto

First of all - my family and I have been going to Red Robin for years and my 10 year old loves the place.  We have visited many locations: Ventura, Thousand Oaks, Anahiem, Calabasas and how excited we were when they opted to build one closer to home - Oxnard.  We went to the location for the about the 6th time since it open.  Now we understand it being a new restaurant, it will go through growing pains, but this is ridiculous!! Showed up today and were seated within minutes.  Our server came over took our drink orders....I ordered WATER.  When he returned with our drinks, my wife and daughter received their drinks, but apparently according to my server he gave mine away to another table.  It took him about another 10 minutes to return to the table with my WATER.  We waited for OVER an additional 40 minutes to get our food.  We were so frustrated that we opted to leave.  We asked for the check to pay for our small drink and appetizer.  The manager quickly came over and offered to comp our meal and pack it to go.  She apologized for them being slow.  We opted to leave.  LAST TIME I VISIT THIS LOCATION.  The RR in Ventura and Thousand Oaks and other locations service is always great.  Too bad that I can't say the same for the RR in my home town.

My family attempted to visit this location on two separate occasions. The first time they stated that they did not have any servers available for outdoor dining. The second time we were told that they did not allow pets in the outdoor dining area due to Health and Safety requirements, however, California state laws permit dogs in outdoor dining areas. The Simi Valley location is listed on Bring Fido so that is weird that one location would be restricted by corporate and others would not. We were advised by the manager to lock our dog outside the fencing if we wanted to dine there. Very disappointing for the entire family, we went a block down and found two dog-friendly restaurants.

I've been to another location and the food was delicious, not this one! Your better off driving thru Carl's Jr. and ordering a $6 burger! We were seated fast and ambience is nice, service was whatever. Waitress seemed kinda rude, like she was done for the day  but in the end it's all about the food. I ordered the whiskey burger, the lettuce was mushy, meat was bland and fries were soggy bleh! Husband ordered the peppercorn burger which was supposed to have bacon!! Told the waitress and instead of taking the burger back she just brought us a side plate of bacon! Really?  All in all I would not come back to this location, like i said before your better off driving thru McDonald's!
Great food, good music,  awesome service. Loved hearing the birthday song. Will be back. Missy was awesome!!!

Decided to take my 6 year old daughter to dinner here. They nailed her pizza and fries kids meal... totally blew it out of the water. Oh but wait, isn't this a Burger place? Well first off the waitress didnt bring napkins... I think it was because she was too busy focusing on calling me Hun and Love (really? im old enough to be her dad). Once or maybe even twice okay, i get it... but it was way overdone but i figured i'd give the millennial a chance. I mean come on, at least she wasn't on her cellphone. My burger came and the cook forgot to put half the toppings of my burger inside. Maybe that's why they called it the ghost burger? Maybe the toppings were really there in spirit? Well i guess not since they ended up bringing them on the side and made me put in my own burger... When i opened the bun i found that the patty was broken, wth? I made an attempt to get through it but after my 2nd bite the entire bun was in pieces. Epic fail! Worst Red Robin experience of all time right here... Sure, the manager took it off the bill. But made we wait another 15 minutes to pay for my kid's meal and offered no other type of compensation... Didn't even credit me my ice tea or $1.99 Entertainment Fee for that tablet at the table that takes away the valuable time you'd like to spend with your kid during a meal.
This was the second time we've gone to the restaurant and the service is horrible. I would not recommend at all

Our visit today really changed our view on this Red Robin in a huge way. The food was great, the service from Moses was awesome.  I'm always honest in my reviews and we've been to this Riverpark location a few times before with not such great service but there has been a huge change that we easily observed today.  My husband and I don't have bread and their lettuce wrapped burgers were perfectly wrapped and delicious.  We will be back and recommend this Red Robin to our friends and family.

I can't complain!! I was so busy chomping my sandwich down I forgot to take a picture before I took my first bite. I prefer the whiskey river chicken sandwich and my husband ordered the whiskey river chicken wrap! Not were delicious. For dessert we shared a nana nana moo moo. That was also good. This location is in the collection @ riverpark the food is good!! Oh and they have a sink in the bathroom small enough for the kids to reach!

Everything about this visit was a hard NO. We went on a Friday evening around 5:00 because we hadn't eaten that day and were hungry for an early dinner. It was a hot, beautiful afternoon out so we asked to sit outside. This is where everything started to go wrong. We were sent outside to seat ourselves by the hostess who didn't give us any menus.  The waitress who was covering the patio had one table that was nearly finished eating and then us. The patio was empty, otherwise. She brought us silverware but still no menus. She said she'd asked someone else to get them and they hadn't so she'd be back. In the meantime, a family was seated, they had their menus and a guy who seemed like a manager took their order despite walking past us several times. After a while, he stopped by and we asked for menus AGAIN.  At this point it was TWENTY MINUTES since we'd sat down. We had to wait another 10 for the actual menus. WTF.  We would have gone someplace else but we were starving by this point and figured if they got the ball rolling we'd eat faster than if we left.  Finally, after several other weird and awkward visits from different waiters and our original waitress, our order was taken. The family of six had eaten, paid and left before our order arrived. I think we waited an additional 45 minutes on top of the original wait. There was not a large crowd. It was an odd time and maybe they were between shifts, but it was just the worst service.   As for the food, the ice in our water glasses tasted like old fries, so I'm guessing the ice is stored near where they make the fries or with the frozen fries in the freezer. If you manage to mess up ice, you're not doing a good job.  The silverware had food stuck to it and the wine glasses were dirty, too. Almost as dirty as the manager dude's fingernails. Almost.  The food was epically sub-par. Not even mediocre. We are it literally because we were just very hungry.  The best part though was when another waitress with a neck tattoo stopped near our table to reach far down into the back of her jeans to pull her underwear up. Guess who ended up serving us our plates? GROSS. I've been to different Red Robins and I have always felt like they were reliably okay. I figured this would be even better since they just opened fairly recently. This must be a very poorly managed restaurant. We left wondering if we were going to get sick over the weekend from the poor quality of food and the remarkable lack of cleanliness we witnessed.  Leaving a place wondering if you're getting sick in a few hours.....well, that pretty much says volumes, doesn't it?

I have been to this location 3 times. 2 times out of the 3 we have received poor service. The first few weeks this location was open, we went. The service and atmosphere was great. The two times we have been back since have been awful. The food was gross, our server didn't even offer us napkins. We had to ask for everything from silverware to ketchup. She never came back to check on us or refill our drinks. This last time the service didn't get better till we mentioned it to the manager. At which point it seemed to be ok, until the manager "Angie" had a less than desirable demeanor. I am a resident of this area and we will never come back. Which makes me sad that I cannot count in good service from a local restaurant. We will drive to the Ventura location from now on.

This Red Robin is located at the Collection at Riverpark near Target. Theres plenty of parking. I've been to this location a few times & had great experiences here. I Love their Burgers! And did you say bottomless Fries? Hello! Food is awesome & so far I've had great customer service. Waiters are pretty cool & attentive.  The one problem I encountered was trying to use the tablet at the table. The waitress said we needed to order appetizers on them. But they did not work right away. I think we actually ordered our food w/ the waitress before we were able to place an order on that thing, smh lol. Oh well, we still got our orders. Then trying to use the tablet to pay was a bit annoying. The waitress had to mess w/ it herself. Maybe a glitch.
